sn36.17:1.1: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn36.17:1.2: “Sir, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?
sn36.17:1.3: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”
sn36.17:1.9: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn36.17:1.10: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn36.17:1.11: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.
sn36.17:1.12: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
sn36.17:1.13: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.
sn36.17:2.1: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of activities. …
sn36.17:2.2: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased. …
sn36.17:2.3: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.
sn36.17:2.4: And I have also explained the progressive settling of activities.
sn36.17:2.5: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled. …
sn36.17:2.6: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.
sn36.17:2.7: There are these six levels of tranquility.
sn36.17:2.8: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized.
sn36.17:2.9: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have been tranquilized.
sn36.17:2.10: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has been tranquilized.
sn36.17:2.11: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has been tranquilized.
sn36.17:2.12: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.
sn36.17:2.13: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”
